author: TNN
title: Rain: Heavy Rain Causes Havoc in Bengaluru, Uproots 70 Trees | Bengaluru News - Times of India
text: BENGALURU: Several areas of the city remained under water for hours after heavy rain lashed the city on Thursday evening and early Friday morning, causing widespread damage and disrupting normal life. The heavy downpour also affected domestic flight services after water leakage in terminal-2 of the KIA. Several main roads were under water, prompting police to redirect traffic to alternative routes. Slow-moving traffic was reported due to waterlogging on Chowdiah Road towards High Grounds Junction and on Ballari Road towards Hebbal due to waterlogging at Sanjaynagar Cross. The situation was worse near RR Nagar Arch on Mysuru Road, where flooding halted incoming traffic towards Nayandahalli, requiring it to be diverted towards Jnanabharathi campus.The overnight flooding primarily affected Terminal 2 (T2) of the airport, which handles most domestic flights. Videos circulating on social media showed water entering the terminal building, causing inconvenience to passengers and impacting flight operations."A very heavy downpour of rain within a short span of time on the evening of May 9, 2024, resulted in water leakage in certain areas of the terminals at Bengaluru airport," Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL), which operates KIA, said in a statement.He said 13 domestic flights, three international passenger flights, and one international cargo flight were diverted to Chennai on Thursday."Our teams promptly responded to the situation to mitigate the impact and restore normal operations. We regret the inconvenience caused to our passengers". it added.The rain coupled with strong winds brought down many trees in several parts of the city including, Jayanagar, Nrupathunga Nagar and RR Nagar.The rains also brought relief to the Bengaluru residents from the blistering summer heat, which they had not witnessed for many decades.Ballari Road was flooded at Hunasamaranahalli near IAF station, leading to a jam of vehicles bound to and from KIA. Several Bengaluru-bound flights were also diverted due to the weather conditions.Over 70 trees were uprooted across the city. Those who had planned long-distance travel had a tough time reaching bus stands and railway stations.The city has been receiving rain for the past four days.According to the India Meteorological Department, Bengaluru city received 14 mm rain in the 24-hour period till 8.30 am on Friday. It said in a statement the maximum and minimum temperature of the city stood at 33 and 22 degrees Celsius respectively in the last 24 hours.Expectations of light to moderate thundershowers with lightning and gusty winds reaching speeds of 30-40 kmph persist, particularly in Dharwad, Gadag, Haveri, Bangalore Urban, Bengaluru Rural and Ramanagara districts.We also published the following articles recently Rituparna Sengupta gets stuck on a waterlogged road due to heavy rain in KolkataRituparna Sengupta faced road trouble in Kolkata, shared video. Fans praise humility. Promoting 'Dabaru'; portrays Karuna Devi. Film narrates chess grandmaster story with Surya character. 'Dabaru' releases on May 10.109912908 Hyderabad massive traffic jams after heavy rainfall lashes cityHyderabad experienced a temperature drop from 47.1 to 40.2 Celsius after heavy rainfall. Serillingampally, Kukatpally, Secunderabad, Khairtabad, Ramachandrapuram had intense rain. Hailstorms hit Miyapur, Kondapur, causing traffic snarls and power cuts near Mindspace.109946085 Last-mile need but traffic menace: City roads caught in e-rick anarchyGurgaon's e-rickshaw surge leads to chaos and accidents. Unregistered vehicles operate illegally, risking passengers and drivers. Safety concerns raised due to lack of robust design. Calls for dedicated lanes to prevent chaos and enhance safety.109896559

title: Clutch Points: Udonis Haslem and Dwyane Wade â€¦ | HoopsHype
text: Udonis Haslem and Dwyane Wade shared a moment last night while looking up at their jerseys in the raftersâ¤ï¸ What a moment for the Heat legends ğŸ™Œ (via @MiamiHEAT) pic.twitter.com/Puu1KauNIK Clutch Points: Rumor Hype Rumor visits per day for the last week Views per day January 20, 2024 | 11:02 am EST Update Blazers sign Taze Moore to 10-day contract Adrian Wojnarowski: The Portland Trail Blazers are signing G Taze Moore of the G Leagueâ€™s Rip City Remix on a 10-day contract,sources tell ESPN. Moore played his college basketball for Kelvin Sampson at Houston. Jorge Sierra: Kevin Durant passed Hassan Whiteside in blocks and Dominique Wilkins in rebounds last night. Just so you know. Michael Scotto: Cam Thomas: â€œI feel like the goal post always moves for me. When people now score all these points, itâ€™s all praise. But when I used to do it, itâ€™s always a knock.He canâ€™t play defense. He doesnâ€™t pass. But when I see other people doing the same thing, itâ€™s praise.â€ pic.twitter.com/FqwnMJF9El Former NBA star DeMarcus Cousinsâ€™ double-double debut saw the Taiwan Beer Leopards secure a 119-90 blowout win against the Tainan TSG GhostHawks on Saturday. The Leopards improved to 9-4 after the game, tying the New Taipei CTBC DEA atop the five-team T1 LEAGUE on the back of a franchise-record five-game winning streak. The 6,015 spectators who turned up for Cousinâ€™s debut also set a new attendance record for the Leopards at the Taoyuan Arena, the franchiseâ€™s home since last summer. Cousins logged 13 points, 10 rebounds, five assists, two steals, and one block in 28:24 on the floor â€” a performance the four-time NBA All-Star suggested he could exceed with adequate rest. â€œIâ€™m jet-lagged; I just got off a 14-hour flight. Iâ€™ll get some recovery after this game, get my legs fresh, and be ready for tomorrow. So hopefully, itâ€™s a better performance,â€ the 33-year-old center said after the game. Udonis Haslem spent 20 seasons wearing a Miami Heat jersey. Now, his jersey will forever hang from the rafters in the Heatâ€™s home arena. During a halftime ceremony in the middle of Friday nightâ€™s game between the Heat and Atlanta Hawks at Kaseya Center, Haslemâ€™s No. 40 jersey was retired by the organization. Haslem, 43, became the sixth Heat player to have his jersey retired, joining Alonzo Mourning, Tim Hardaway, Shaquille Oâ€™Neal, Chris Bosh and Dwyane Wade. â€œLook at the list of the guys Iâ€™m sitting with,â€ Haslem said, referring to the first five Heat players who had their jerseys retired and are already in the Basketball Hall of Fame. â€œThatâ€™s whatâ€™s huge to me.Thatâ€™s what makes me feel so amazing is the core group of guys that Iâ€™m sitting with. Pat Riley ainâ€™t just putting anybody up there. The Arisons ainâ€™t just OKâ€™ing anybody to go up in those rafters.â€ Haslem, who was born at Miamiâ€™s North Shore Medical Center and grew up in Liberty City before playing at Miami High, then dedicated a part of his speech to his hometown of Miami â€” the area code 305. â€œLiberty City, Overtown, Little Havana, Little Haiti, everybody, tonight when this jersey goes up in the rafters, all of yâ€™all coming with me,â€ Haslem said during the speech.â€œThe love yâ€™all show me in this city, I love you guys, I appreciate you guys. â€¦. 305, you got to hold it up. You got to hold up the 305. Tonight, we all celebrate, 305.â€ Even though Haslemâ€™s playing career is over and his Heat jersey is now retired, heâ€™ll remain around the organization.The Heat hired him as the vice president of basketball development in November and he still hopes to become part of the Heatâ€™s ownership group one day. â€œTo be able to get out, make it, excel and succeed, I hope itâ€™s a great example for other kids in Miami, in Liberty City and for my kids, as well,â€ Haslem said. â€œâ€¦ This is a dream come true.â€ January 20, 2024 | 10:28 am EST Update Wizards sign Trey Jemison Shams Charania: The Washington Wizards plan to sign center Trey Jemison to a 10-day contract out of the NBA G Leagueâ€™s Birmingham Squadronsources tell @TheAthletic @Stadium. Jemison has averaged 13.6 points and 12.3 rebounds in G League this season. Justin Kubatko: Nikola Jokic last night: âœ… 34 PTS âœ… 12 REB âœ… 9 AST âœ… 14-22 FG Jokic has scored 263 points over his last 11 games, shooting 74.8% from the field, 57.1% from 3-point range, and 85.4% from the free throw line ğŸ˜³More in this morningâ€™s free game notes: statitudes.com/p/nba-game-notâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/SqCo4UHFhX Justin Kubatko: Joel Embiid last night: âœ… 36 PTS âœ… 7 REB âœ… 4 STL âœ… 12-22 FG âœ… 11-11 FT Itâ€™s the 19th straight 30-point game for Embiid, breaking a tie with Elgin Baylor for the sixth-longest such streak in NBA history. More in todayâ€™s free game notes: statitudes.com/p/nba-game-notâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/azlhwcJE3h Justin Kubatko: Devin Booker was ğŸ”¥ last night: âœ… 52 PTS âœ… 18-30 FG âœ… 6-11 3P âœ… 10-10 FT

author: EVA FEDDERLY
title: PLN prevails in censorship suit against Walton County Jail in Georgia | Prison Legal News
text: PLN prevails in censorship suit against Walton County Jail in Georgia [http://www.courthousenews.com/2015/10/13/prison...](http://www.courthousenews.com/2015/10/13/prison-legal-news-scores-victory-in-rural-georgia.htm) Prison Legal News Scores Victory in Rural Georgia (CN) - A Georgia prison must pay over $100,000 in legal fees and expenses to a human rights advocacy group because jailers unconstitutionally banned delivery of its publication, a federal judge ruled. Prison Legal News, a monthly publication that covers criminal justice-related news and litigation nationwide, [sued](http://www.courthousenews.com/2015/10/13/prison%20legal%20news%20complaint.pdf) the Walton County Jail in Monroe, Ga., Sheriff Joe Chapman, and Jail Commander Wade Harris in September 1992, after they instituted a postcard-only mail policy. The jail typically houses about 350 inmates at any given time, and the policy essentially gave teeth to an already existing ban on publications and periodicals of all kinds. "The Jail's policies and practices do not afford prisoners or their correspondents adequate notice of nor an opportunity to challenge improper mail censorship or rejection," the complaint filed by Prison Legal News' publisher, Human Rights Defense Center, said. After a bench trial, Chief U.S. District Judge c. Ashley Royal held that while the jail's postcard-only policy passed judicial muster, the resulting publication ban was unconstitutional. But the ruling left no one declaring victory. Afterwards, Lance Webber, counsel for Human Rights Defense Center, told Courthouse News, "This means that PLN cannot notify its subscribers at the Walton County jail about the disposition of the case by providing them with a copy of the attached ruling unless PLN were to print out the ruling on multiple postcards or write an article about the case result and deliver the information through the pages of its magazine. "I think that this means that the prisoners are effectively banned from reading this ruling, unless it were to be sent to a prisoner via legal mail from an attorney." Jail Commander Wade Harris told Courthouse News that the publication ban was in place when he took command in 2005. "I started doing some research at that time and found that courts had ruled that this policy was unconstitutional. We started working on our anti-publication policy to figure out how to address that," he said. "We were already working on the anti-publication policy when PLN filed the lawsuit," he added. The postcard-only policy was implemented at Walton County Jail in 2010. "It sounded like a really good idea because we wouldn't be restricting the inmates to only writing X amount of postcards or letters," said Harris. "A lot of times correspondence contains information we would need to know about, such as security breaches and contraband. Inmates are less likely to put contraband on a postcard," he continued. "I thought it was a really good idea so we implemented the post-card only policy in 2010. We don't want to keep them from talking to people on the outside." "It is undisputed that participation in educational activities behind bars is directly related to lower rates of recidivism among released prisoners. Reading is a fundamental part of education," Weber told Courthouse News. "It is also undisputed that prisoners who maintain personal connections with friends and family are less likely to return to prison or jail once released, than those who do not regularly communicate with their friends and family," he said. "Unnecessarily restrictive mail policies like Sheriff Chapman's postcard-only mail policy are bad for public safety because they contribute to higher recidivism rates."

title: IVA Zero beneficiou os consumidores, diz economista JoÃ£o Duque - RenascenÃ§a
text: 28 dez, 2023 - 17:52 â€¢ [Teresa Paula Costa](https://rr.sapo.pt/artigo/33588/teresa-paula-costa) com redaÃ§Ã£o O IVA Zero no cabaz de bens alimentares essenciais teve impacto positivo na vida das pessoas, disse esta quinta-feira o economista JoÃ£o Duque. Em declaraÃ§Ãµes Ã  RenascenÃ§a, JoÃ£o Duque afirmou que â€œnÃ£o hÃ¡ a mÃ­nima dÃºvida de que houve um benefÃ­cioâ€ para as pessoas, dado que â€œos intermediÃ¡rios, a rede de retalho, ficaram mesmo com IVA Zeroâ€. Contudo, â€œcom o evoluir dos preÃ§os durante o ano, esse benefÃ­cio rapidamente foi comido e as pessoas acabam por nÃ£o sentir, porque, na prÃ¡tica, tambÃ©m nÃ£o era muito significativo o valor do IVA Zero, porque se aplicava a produtos em que o IVA jÃ¡ era muito baixo em muitos casosâ€, explicou. Isso justifica a perceÃ§Ã£o das pessoas de que a medida introduzida pelo Governo nÃ£o resultou. Os consumidores reconhecem o benefÃ­cio de IVA Zero(...) Questionado sobre o comportamento dos consumidores neste final de ano, o economista nÃ£o se mostrou surpreendido. â€œSinceramente, acho que era de esperar, porque os aumentos salariais da maior parte dos portugueses ocorreram muito no inÃ­cio do ano de 2023, e a inflaÃ§Ã£o continua a fazer sentir-se durante todo o ano e, portanto, vamos tendo cada vez menos folgaâ€, explicou. Por outro lado, â€œem cima da inflaÃ§Ã£o, hÃ¡ um problema que afeta muitos portugueses que, de facto, foi o aumento das taxas de juro e o acrÃ©scimo muito significativo dos valores que pagam mensalmente para amortizaÃ§Ã£o do capital de jurosâ€. Tendo tambÃ©m em conta â€œo facto das poupanÃ§as feitas durante a pandemia jÃ¡ se terem ido por outras viasâ€œ, os portugueses debatem-se com falta de dinheiro e esperam que â€œno prÃ³ximo mÃªs, mesmo com o IVA aumentado, talvez os aumentos salariais e as atualizaÃ§Ãµes salariais de que venham a beneficiar, possam compensarâ€. Sobre a possibilidade de virem a ser criados outros apoios, o economista disse acreditar que sim, mas â€œpara os que mais necessitam.â€

author: Press Trust of India
title: Governing country as per â€˜Manusmritiâ€™ BJPâ€™s secret agenda: JD-U
text: New Delhi: The BJP brings up Sanatan Dharma whenever the issue of its government â€œcurtailingâ€ the rights of the backwards, Dalits, tribals and minorities are raised as it is working on a â€œsecret agendaâ€ of governing the country as per the â€˜Manusmritiâ€™, the JD-U said on Friday. In a resolution adopted at its national council meeting here, the Janata Dal-United (JD-U) noted that the country is passing through the â€œmost difficultâ€ phase since independence as the BJP-led Centre is moving towards â€œdictatorshipâ€. [Nitish Kumar elected JD(U) president](/nitish-kumar-elected-jdu-president-2944388/) â€œFear, hatred and frenzy are being created in society. Politics has started taking the form of deceit and revenge,â€ it said, alleging that all this is the result of the deeds of the BJP government which is in power at the Centre. â€œThis is the biggest threat to our democracy and the Constitution. The central government is moving towards dictatorship. The constitutional institutions and federal structure of the country are being weakened,â€ the resolution read. In the last nine years, this situation has worsened and taken a â€œhorrible shapeâ€, it said, alleging that the BJP-led Centre is not paying attention to the problems of the people and raising â€œfalse slogansâ€ to deflect the common peopleâ€™s attention from the problems. â€œAt a time when the entire opposition is talking about saving the Constitution framed by Baba Saheb Bhimrao Ambedkar, the BJP is raising the issue of Sanatan,â€ the Nitish Kumar-led party charged. â€œWe all respect Sanatan culture, values, traditions and its ideals. There is no opposition anywhere on this. But when we raise the issue of the BJP government curtailing the rights of backward classes, Dalits, tribals and minorities guaranteed under the Constitution, then suddenly they remember Sanatan,â€ it said. The reality is that the BJP has â€œhiddenâ€ â€˜Manusmritiâ€™ under the cloak of Sanatan, it added. â€œThey want that India should not be governed on the basis of Baba Sahebâ€™s Constitution, rather the governance and social system should be governed on the basis of â€˜Manusmritiâ€™. This is the secret agenda of BJP,â€ the JD-U resolution charged.
